title.text: A Pragmatic Approach to Summary Extraction in Clinical Trials

datasetContent.text: Manual PEA validation was done on a random sample of 300 trials.
For a stricter test, the 13,110 studies with Purpose sections short enough to include in full without any type of processing or decision were not part of the random sample.
Judgments were provided by the authors, one of whom was not involved in the development of PEA code.
The 300 English extracts (before translation) were compared against the full-text Purpose sections in the clinical trials, with compression rate averaging 30%.
Evaluation was done on a 3-point scale: perfect extraction, appropriate, wrong text.
Inter-annotator agreement using Cohen's kappa was considered to be good (Kappa = 0.756987).

tableCaptions.text: Table 2: Results: 300 Clinical trials random sample
